education_certification.credential: JD from an accredited law school

duties_responsibilities.duty: Investigate and prosecute healthcare providers who defraud the Medi-Cal program and those who abuse or neglect elderly and dependent adults in care facilities.
Work closely with the Division’s special agents and investigative auditors, advising on the development of investigative plans, reviewing search warrants and arrest warrants.
Litigate criminal or civil prosecutions from filing to conviction and sentencing or settlement.
Establish criminal and civil liability of owners, operators, and controlling entities of adult residential care facilities.
Conduct complex legal and other research, and stay up to date in the rapidly changing fields of health care law, elder law, and electronic evidence.

Collaborate with multi-disciplinary teams in conducting investigations and litigating cases, and work with regulatory and executive agencies which may take administrative actions concurrent with the investigations.
Responsible for cases statewide and required to travel throughout California.
